subject: Bank of New York Mellon
body:
Bank of New York Mellon
Corporate investment banking company
240 Greenwich Street Manhattan, New York City, U.S.
This Is To Let You Know That World Bank Group’s Board Of Executive Directors Has Reopened Our Services To Beneficiaries On A Project To Provide Cash Support To 270,000 Vulnerable household units Including Those Who Recently Lost Their Source Of Income As A Result Of The Pandemic and of all unclaimed inheritance funds, contract funds, lottery funds, etc.
Given This Development, We Are Fully Aware That Many Beneficiaries May Have Died As A Result Of The Pandemic And Therefore Could Not Claim Their Pending Funds.
Bank of New York Mellon Was Appointed By The Office Of World Bank Auditors To Make Such Payments To The Concerned Beneficiaries. The Sum Of USD 5,400,000.00 Has Been Approved By World Bank Auditors To Be Paid To Each Beneficiary Concerned Out Of His/Her Total Fund As Part Payment.
We, Therefore, Want You To Get Back To Us If You Are Still Alive By Forwarding Your Full Details Such As
Your Full Names
Address
Phone Number
Age
Occupation
The Only Thing We Will Do Is re-validate your File So That It Will Become More Authentic And Be Among the Files That Will Be On Our Pay List.
This Is A Golden Opportunity For You To Receive Your Fund. Thanks For Your Anticipated Cooperation.
Your Immediate Response Is Highly Needed To Enable Us To Commence The Transfer.
Publicity Department.
Bank of New York Mellon.

subject: Re: Bank of New York Mellon
body:
Hello! Thank you for sharing this information with me. It's interesting to hear about the services being reopened to provide support during these challenging times. Can you tell me more about how the process works for receiving the funds? How can individuals ensure that they are eligible to receive assistance?

Best wishes,
Diana

Bank of New York Mellon
Corporate investment banking company
240 Greenwich Street Manhattan, New York City, U.S.
Relationship Manager
Banking Director, Credit Control Dept.
Lobby: Mon-Thu 9-4, Fri 9-6, Sat 9-1, Sun Closed
Phone: 1-(347) 201-9266

Our Ref: BNY/NY-USA/TTD/025-118/24

Bank of New York Mellon appreciates your response in regards to our notice
of fund transaction,
Reading from your reply it means you do not understand the context of my
email or you are just skeptical about the message due to the numerous
impersonated letters sent by impostors

However, there is absolutely nothing to be worried about because all
contexts of our letter are legal and legitimate under law and government
observance, we request that all required details be sent for a fast and
efficient process to conclude this transaction.

This fund originated from the World Bank Group’s project to provide cash
support to 270,000 vulnerable households Unit including those who recently
lost their source of income as a result of the pandemic in Europe, Asia,
Africa, North and South America, Australia, Antarctica continent, in other,
to help improve their businesses, in accordance to the explanations are
given to our bank on this fund distribution scheme state that all
beneficiary was chosen randomly from various countries of the world to be a
receiver of this said fund for investment purpose, thus employ the poor
masses to help eradicate poverty and help the world bank/UN achieve their
aim of global rehabilitation.

Given this reason, you were chosen to receive this fund and represent the
World Bank/UN as an envoy in your country for this fund distribution scheme.

Here in the United States of America, our bank (Bank of New York Mellon)
was chosen as the legally accepted bank to assist in the distribution of
these funds to all listed beneficiaries, for this reason, we sent a legal
notification (e-mail) to accord this news to you as one of the benefactors
of this fund.

Hope with my explanation I have been able to clear your curiosity about the
source and origin of this fund worth $5,400,000.00 United States dollars.

Kindly send these required details.
1. Your full name
2. Your phone number
3. Your address

Thank you for banking with Bank of New York Mellon and have a pleasant day.

Yours In Service-
*Mr. Derrick James*
*Relationship Manager**,*
*Phone: 1-(347) 201-9266*
CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE

disclosure, reproduction, distribution, or other use of this message or any
attachments by an individual or entity other than the intended recipient is
prohibited

subject: Re: Bank of New York Mellon
body:
Hello! Thank you for sharing this information about Bank of New York Mellon and the fund originating from the World Bank Group project. It's interesting to learn about the support being provided to vulnerable households around the world.

Could you please provide more details on how individuals are selected to receive this fund for investment purposes? I'm curious about the process and criteria involved in choosing recipients.

Additionally, what steps should one take to ensure that the required details are securely shared with your bank for processing?

Looking forward to hearing more from you!

Best wishes,
Diana

little knowledge of because my participation here is to make sure the fund
is disbursed to all listed benefactors submitted to our bank payroll.

Firstly, we need your acknowledgment of this letter and your willingness to
receive the cash support program funds by sending the details requested in
our previous email for validation and documentation purposes.

Thank you for banking with Bank of New York Mellon and have a pleasant day.

Our Ref: BNY/NY-USA/TTD/025-118/24

On more inquiries, I was told the selection of beneficiaries were randomly
selected from various countries through their government-approved business
directory portfolio and hence assume that is how you became listed as one
of the benefactors.

This cash support program is worth $5,400,000.00 to be disbursed to various
beneficiaries who are listed on the office-signed document that was
submitted to our bank for this transaction.

Once your details are received, It indicates interest and agreement to
represent the World Bank Swiss/UN as an envoy in your environment and country.
Your details will be submitted back to the World Bank Swiss to get an
approval document showing that this transaction is legitimate under law and
government supervision.

Thank you for banking with Bank of New York Mellon and have a pleasant day.
Yours In Service-
*Mr. Derrick James*
*Relationship Manager**,*
*Phone: 1-(347) 201-9266*
